skill.name: Test Infrastructure Agent - Real Coverage Builder
skill.description: **Purpose**: Creates and maintains comprehensive test coverage. No stubs, no fakes, no empty files.
skill.summary: **Purpose**: Creates and maintains comprehensive test coverage. No stubs, no fakes, no empty files.
skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and testing guidelines. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution, no environment variable access. This is a safe documentation-only skill.

content.value_statement: Teams waste time on stub files that count toward coverage but catch no bugs. This skill creates real tests with actual assertions that verify behavior and catch regressions before production.
actual_capabilities: Audit existing test files to identify stubs and gaps
Write unit tests for functions and business logic
Write integration tests for API routes and database operations
Write component tests for React UI rendering and interactions
Prioritize tests by critical path and risk level
Enforce quality gates for meaningful test assertions
limitations: Does not execute tests or verify they pass
Does not modify production code to improve testability
Does not configure CI/CD pipelines or test runners
Does not generate mock data or test fixtures

use_cases.title: Audit test coverage gaps
use_cases.description: Analyze codebase to find empty test files and identify critical paths missing coverage

use_cases.title: Create test specifications
use_cases.description: Write comprehensive tests for API endpoints, components, and service layers following best practices

use_cases.title: Enforce quality standards
use_cases.description: Establish testing guidelines that prevent stubs and ensure meaningful assertions

prompt_templates.title: Assess current coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit our test suite. Count real test lines in each file, identify stub files with less than 50 lines, and report: total tests with coverage, empty test files, critical gaps, and estimated hours to fix.

prompt_templates.title: Write unit tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Write unit tests for the contactScoringEngine function. Include tests for high engagement contacts, zero engagement contacts, and error cases. Use real assertions that verify exact scores.

prompt_templates.title: Write API tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Write integration tests for POST /api/contacts endpoint. Test happy path (creates contact with valid data), auth rejection (missing token), and validation errors (invalid email format). Verify database writes.

prompt_templates.title: Write component tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Write component tests for HotLeadsPanel. Test that it renders leads, filtering interaction works, and empty state displays correctly. Use React Testing Library with fireEvent for interactions.

best_practices: Write tests that actually assert something meaningful, not just that code runs
Prioritize critical revenue and security paths first, then features
Test error cases and boundaries, not just happy paths
anti_patterns: Empty test files that inflate coverage percentage without testing behavior
Mocking the thing you are supposed to be testing
Tests that pass whether the code works or not

faq.question: Which testing frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Jest, Vitest, React Testing Library, and any describe/it syntax. Can adapt to other frameworks.

faq.question: What coverage percentage should we target?
faq.answer: Target 75%+ real coverage with 100% on critical paths like auth, payments, and data operations.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with our CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: This skill generates tests. Run them in CI using your existing test runner and coverage reporting.

faq.question: Is my production data safe during testing?
faq.answer: The skill creates test definitions. Test execution with real data depends on your test environment configuration.

faq.question: Why are my tests not catching bugs?
faq.answer: Check that tests have real assertions, test actual behavior not implementation, and include error cases.

faq.question: How is this different from auto-generated tests?
faq.answer: This skill creates meaningful tests with real assertions. Auto-generated tests often just call functions without verifying outcomes.
